result.execSummary:
The defendant Montgomery D Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered no DNA sample or surcharge as stipulated by parties as this case predates the change in law.

Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation.  If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment unless attending full time school.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdmeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Huber privileges for work only.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Donna Dennie.
Letter from Donna Dennie, received and filed.
The request for expungement is denied, filed and signed by the Court.  The DOC filed a Notice of Failure to meet conditions for expungement.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc
Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement, filed by DOC.
No certificate of discharge and verification of completion of probation conditions has been received, and therefore, the defendant's request for expungement is deemed abandoned.
Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant requesting expungement.
Bail Refund Packets
8/10/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety/defendant.

Defendant Montgomery D Jackson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the state, the Court orally amended count 1:  Failure to obey directions of a traffic officer, contrary to Wis. sec. 346.04(2)(t), a Class U misdemeanor.  

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.    
 
Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 18 days in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work only.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment unless attending full time school.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Court ordered no DNA sample or surcharge as stipulated by parties as this case predates the change in law.
 
- Pay all costs and surcharges within term of probation.  If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.
Telephone call from attorney Vince Guimont to schedule projected guilty plea hearing.  Through follow-up emails, case calendared for projected guilty plea on August 5, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.
State's Motion in Limine filed.
State's Witness List filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed.

Defendant Montgomery D Jackson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  
Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Hearing proceeded.  Request for Substitution filed by defense due to Chief Judge Directive 15-10 (effective August 03, 2015) reassigning this case to Judge Jeffrey Conen, Branch 30.   Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge William Pocan, Br. 26.  Per Branch 26 jury date previously selected by the parties to remain.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Montgomery D Jackson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense requests to adjourn the Jury Trial date.
Court GRANTS request.
Court CONVERTED the 05-27-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date to a Final Pretrial Conference date.
Jury Trial adjourned to 08-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Montgomery D Jackson in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Ronald Dague for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Borchardt-Greenfield Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
